qas.question: When did European sport clubs begin to form in the Ottoman empire?
Where did football matches become to be popular in the Ottoman empire?
What was the leading sport club in 1905?
In what year did the Altay Sports Club form?
What was the football club known as Ülküspor formerly known as?

context: The main sports Ottomans were engaged in were Turkish Wrestling, hunting, Turkish archery, horseback riding, Equestrian javelin throw, arm wrestling, and swimming. European model sports clubs were formed with the spreading popularity of football matches in <a0_0>19th century<a0_0/> <a1_0>Constantinople<a1_0/>. The leading clubs, according to timeline, were Beşiktaş Gymnastics Club (1903), <a2_0>Galatasaray Sports Club<a2_0/> (1905) and Fenerbahçe Sports Club (1907) in Istanbul. Football clubs were formed in other provinces too, such as Karşıyaka Sports Club (1912), Altay Sports Club (<a3_0>1914<a3_0/>) and <a4_0>Turkish Fatherland Football Club<a4_0/> (later Ülküspor) (1914) of İzmir.
